Question.Subject: I have a male and female cockatiel, and there are 2 eggs in the bottom of the cage, will they hatch?

Answers.Answer: Most likely not, if there is not a bird sitting on the eggs.

This is hard to tell. Cockatiels can lay unfertilized eggs as well. Just because you have a male and female, it cannot be guaranteed the two mated.
You can try picking up the eggs and holding it up against a very bright light. If you see a dark spot in the egg, that means it is fertilized and will hatch if cared for properly.
Have fun.
